subject: Climate & Environment
title: Plastic in the Water
description: A fast breakdown of Plastic in the Water for builders.

hook.text: Every year, 11 million tons of plastic enter the ocean. That is a garbage truck per minute.

buildup.text: Plastic doesn't decompose â€” it breaks into smaller and smaller pieces called microplastics.

discovery.text: Microplastics have been found in fish, shellfish, drinking water, and human blood.

twist.text: Only 9% of all plastic ever made has been recycled. The rest is in landfills, burned, or loose.

climax.text: By 2050, the ocean could contain more plastic by weight than fish.

punchline.text: Plastic never goes away. It just gets smaller and harder to find.

quiz.question: How much plastic enters the ocean each year?
